contextvoting 0.0.0.1
  • Reference

All One Stage Voting in Action

prefsoc.Rd

Conducting one stage of election.

prefsoc(soc, commonfactor = 0.1, groupfactor = 0.8,
  personalfactor = 1, updatecommonfactor = 0.1,
  updategroupfactor = 0, updatepersonalfactor = 0,
  groupfactor_type = "constant", knowmean1 = 0.65, knowmean2 = 0.65,
  knowspread = 0.85, partyblue_startloc = -0.8,
  partyred_startloc = 0.8, partystartloc_noise = 0.5,
  partyblue_startcapacity = 0, partyred_startcapacity = 0,
  partystartcapacity_noise = 0.5, partyloc_noise = 0,
  partycapacity_noise = 0, partyblue_loc_direction = 0,
  partyred_loc_direction = 0, partyblue_capacity_direction = 0,
  partyred_capacity_direction = 0, partyupdate_type = "oneshot",
  signaldifficulty = 3, signalbias_common = 0,
  signalbias_ingroup = 0, context_type = "region", contextradius = 5,
  contexttimetoagg = 2, b_idedist = 0.198, b_capacity = 0.716,
  b_incumbent = 1.526, b_pvi_nation = -9.827, b_pvi_local = 5.156,
  b_pvi_sublocal = 1.663, b_pid = 1.215,
  burnin_redvoteprob_sd = 0.045, burnin_redvoteprob_cor = 0.19,
  seedval = NULL)

Arguments

soc

The lists generated initially by initialsoc.
commonfactor

The common factor in ideology (intercept).
groupfactor

The group influence on ideology.
personalfactor

The random personal factor in ideology (The SD of the random error to the model).
updatecommonfactor

The movement in common factor.
updategroupfactor

The movement in group influence on ideology.
updatepersonalfactor

The SD for the movemebnt in personal influence on ideology.
groupfactor_type

If "constant", groupfactor is the constant coefficient for group. If "diverging", groupfactor is the SD for folded normal distribution that randomly assigns coeffcient for group.
knowmean1

The lowest average level of knowledge for a group.
knowmean2

The highest average level of knowledge for a group.
knowspread

The spread (SD for normal distribution) of knowledg within a group.
partyblue_startloc

Starting location of blue party ideology.
partyred_startloc

Starting location of red party ideology.
partystartloc_noise

Random noise given to the starting locations of party ideologies.
partyblue_startcapacity

Starting level of blue party capacity.
partyred_startcapacity

Starting level of red party capacity.
partystartcapacity_noise

Random noise given to the starting level of party capacities.
partyloc_noise

Random noise in updating locations of party ideologies.
partycapacity_noise

Random noise in updating party capacity.
partyblue_loc_direction

Direction and expected quantity of the movement in blue party ideology.
partyred_loc_direction

Direction and expected quantity of the movement in red party ideology.
partyblue_capacity_direction

Direction and expected quantity of the movement in blue party capacity.
partyred_capacity_direction

Direction and expected quantity of the movement in red party capacity.
partyupdate_type

The type of updating procedure. If "oneshot", the update is always given over startloc and startcapacity defined in setparty at each election. If "online", the update is given over the ideology and capacity realized in the previous election. If "fromstart" the update is given over the ideology and capacity realized in the first election of the simulation run.
signaldifficulty

The extent of noise level in signal.
signalbias_common

The extent of common directional bias (i.e., positive value advantages red party and vice versa) in signal.
signalbias_ingroup

The extent of common ingroup bias (i.e., Evaluate the ingroup candidate better).
context_type

"region" (default) or "network" (currently not used).
contextradius

Radius to seach neighbors. Only applied when context_type=="network" (currently not used).
contexttimetoagg

How many previous elections to average. Either 1 or 2 (default).
b_idedist

The influence of ideological distance. The default = 0.198, # From ANES
b_capacity

The influence of capacity The default = 0.716, # From ANES
b_incumbent

The influence if incumebent. The default = 1.526, # From ANES (EDV result)
b_pvi_nation

The influence of national PVI. The default = -9.827, # From ANES (EDV result)
b_pvi_local

The influence of regional PVI. The default = 5.156, # From CCES pvi_state
b_pvi_sublocal

The influence of sub-regional PVI. The default = 1.663, # From CCES pvi_state
b_pid

The influence of group membership. The default = 1.215, # From ANES
burnin_redvoteprob_sd

The spread for the "burn-in" period (i.e., first two elections) voting behaviors. See details.
burnin_redvoteprob_cor

The correlation between voting and group in "burn-in" period voting behaviors. See details.
seedval

The random number seed.

Value

List object with society characteristics, including following elements:

  • grid The grid of voters (with group membership at each cell)

  • grid_region The grid of region identifier at each cell.

  • grid_subregion The grid of sub-region identifier at each cell.

  • grid_coords All grid coordinates.

  • group The numeric vector of group memberships

  • region_stat Aggregated group statistics by region.

  • subregion_stat Aggregated group statistics by region.

  • grid_votes2 The grid of voting decisions in t-2 election.

  • grid_votes1 The grid of voting decisions in t-1 election.

  • ideology Created by setideology, may be updated by updateideology

  • knowledge Created by setknowledge

  • context Created by getregion

  • signal Created by getsignal

  • incumbent Character of incumbent party. Either "blue" or "red".

  • votes Created by letsvote

Details

In the first two elections, the model does not have the sufficient number of previous elections to aggregate. If the society does not cotain the information of two previous elections, the hypothetical votes in first two election is radomly provided by the following procedure.

  • Draw the reference value of voting for red for each group of voters by multi-variate normal distribution with mean 0 and the covariance with group membership (i.e., -1, or 1) set by burnin_redvoteprob_cor.

  • Multiply the reference values by burnin_redvoteprob_sd and add 0.5 to generate the probability of red vote for each group.

  • Draw vote of voters in each group by the Bernouli distribution with probability drawin in the previous step.

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
  • Details
